service:
Welcome to the Entity Resolution API Reference.

Entity Resolution is an Amazon Web Services service that provides pre-configured entity resolution capabilities that enable developers and analysts at advertising and marketing companies to build an accurate and complete view of their consumers.

With Entity Resolution, you can match source records containing consumer identifiers, such as name, email address, and phone number. This is true even when these records have incomplete or conflicting identifiers. For example, Entity Resolution can effectively match a source record from a customer relationship management (CRM) system with a source record from a marketing system containing campaign information.

To learn more about Entity Resolution concepts, procedures, and best practices, see the Entity Resolution User Guide.

operations.CreateMatchingWorkflow: Creates a MatchingWorkflow object which stores the configuration of the data processing job to be run. It is important to note that there should not be a pre-existing MatchingWorkflow with the same name. To modify an existing workflow, utilize the UpdateMatchingWorkflow API.
operations.CreateSchemaMapping: Creates a schema mapping, which defines the schema of the input customer records table. The SchemaMapping also provides Entity Resolution with some metadata about the table, such as the attribute types of the columns and which columns to match on.
operations.DeleteMatchingWorkflow: Deletes the MatchingWorkflow with a given name. This operation will succeed even if a workflow with the given name does not exist.
operations.DeleteSchemaMapping: Deletes the SchemaMapping with a given name. This operation will succeed even if a schema with the given name does not exist. This operation will fail if there is a DataIntegrationWorkflow object that references the SchemaMapping in the workflow's InputSourceConfig.
operations.GetMatchId: Returns the corresponding Match ID of a customer record if the record has been processed.
operations.GetMatchingJob: Gets the status, metrics, and errors (if there are any) that are associated with a job.
operations.GetMatchingWorkflow: Returns the MatchingWorkflow with a given name, if it exists.
operations.GetSchemaMapping: Returns the SchemaMapping of a given name.
operations.ListMatchingJobs: Lists all jobs for a given workflow.
operations.ListMatchingWorkflows: Returns a list of all the MatchingWorkflows that have been created for an Amazon Web Services account.
operations.ListSchemaMappings: Returns a list of all the SchemaMappings that have been created for an Amazon Web Services account.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Displays the tags associated with an Entity Resolution resource. In Entity Resolution, SchemaMapping, and MatchingWorkflow can be tagged.
operations.StartMatchingJob: Starts the MatchingJob of a workflow. The workflow must have previously been created using the CreateMatchingWorkflow endpoint.
operations.TagResource: Assigns one or more tags (key-value pairs) to the specified Entity Resolution resource. Tags can help you organize and categorize your resources. You can also use them to scope user permissions by granting a user permission to access or change only resources with certain tag values. In Entity Resolution, SchemaMapping and MatchingWorkflow can be tagged. Tags don't have any semantic meaning to Amazon Web Services and are interpreted strictly as strings of characters. You can use the TagResource action with a resource that already has tags. If you specify a new tag key, this tag is appended to the list of tags associated with the resource. If you specify a tag key that is already associated with the resource, the new tag value that you specify replaces the previous value for that tag.
operations.UntagResource: Removes one or more tags from the specified Entity Resolution resource. In Entity Resolution, SchemaMapping, and MatchingWorkflow can be tagged.
operations.UpdateMatchingWorkflow: Updates an existing MatchingWorkflow. This method is identical to CreateMatchingWorkflow, except it uses an HTTP PUT request instead of a POST request, and the MatchingWorkflow must already exist for the method to succeed.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action. HTTP Status Code: 403

refs.RuleBasedProperties$attributeMatchingMod: The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the AttributeMatchingModel. When choosing MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A and the value of BusinessEmail field of Profile B matches, the two profiles are matched on the Email type. When choosing ONE_TO_ONE ,the system can only match if the sub-types are exact matches. For example, only when the value of the Email field of Profile A and the value of the Email field of Profile B matches, the two profiles are matched on the Email type.

refs.OutputAttribute$name: A name of a column to be written to the output. This must be an InputField name in the schema mapping.
refs.SchemaInputAttribute$groupName: Instruct Entity Resolution to combine several columns into a unified column with the identical attribute type. For example, when working with columns such as first_name, middle_name, and last_name, assigning them a common GroupName will prompt Entity Resolution to concatenate them into a single value.
refs.SchemaInputAttribute$matchKey: A key that allows grouping of multiple input attributes into a unified matching group. For example, let's consider a scenario where the source table contains various addresses, such as business_address and shipping_address. By assigning the MatchKey Address to both attributes, Entity Resolution will match records across these fields to create a consolidated matching group. If no MatchKey is specified for a column, it won't be utilized for matching purposes but will still be included in the output table.

refs.InputSource$applyNormalization: Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.
refs.OutputAttribute$hashed: Enables the ability to hash the column values in the output.
refs.OutputSource$applyNormalization: Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.

ConflictException.base: The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource. Example: Workflow already exists, Schema already exists, Workflow is currently running, etc. HTTP Status Code: 400

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$workflowName: The name of the workflow. There cannot be multiple DataIntegrationWorkflows with the same name.
refs.CreateSchemaMappingInput$schemaName: The name of the schema. There cannot be multiple SchemaMappings with the same name.
refs.DeleteMatchingWorkflowInput$workflowName: The name of the workflow to be retrieved.
refs.DeleteSchemaMappingInput$schemaName: The name of the schema to delete.
refs.GetSchemaMappingInput$schemaName: The name of the schema to be retrieved.
refs.InputSource$schemaName: The name of the schema to be retrieved.
refs.ListMatchingJobsInput$workflowName: The name of the workflow to be retrieved.
refs.StartMatchingJobInput$workflowName: The name of the matching job to be retrieved.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$workflowName: The name of the workflow to be retrieved.

ErrorDetails.base: An object containing an error message, if there was an error.

refs.GetMatchingJobOutput$errorDetails: An object containing an error message, if there was an error.

refs.ErrorDetails$errorMessage: The error message from the job, if there is one.

ExceedsLimitException.base: The request was rejected because it attempted to create resources beyond the current Entity Resolution account limits. The error message describes the limit exceeded. HTTP Status Code: 402

IncrementalRunConfig.base: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$incrementalR: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.
refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$incremental: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$incrementalRun: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$incrementalR: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowOutput$incremental: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field.

refs.IncrementalRunConfig$incrementalRunType: The type of incremental run. It takes only one value: IMMEDIATE.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$inputSourceC: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName.
refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$inputSource: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$inputSourceCon: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$inputSourceC: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowOutput$inputSource: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName.

refs.InputSource$inputSourceARN: An Glue table ARN for the input source table.

refs.ExceedsLimitException$quotaValue: The current quota value for the customers.
refs.JobMetrics$recordsNotProcessed: The total number of records that did not get processed.

InternalServerException.base: This exception occurs when there is an internal failure in the Entity Resolution service. HTTP Status Code: 500

refs.ListMatchingJobsOutput$jobs: A list of JobSummary objects, each of which contain the ID, status, start time, and end time of a job.

refs.GetMatchingJobOutput$metrics: Metrics associated with the execution, specifically total records processed, unique IDs generated, and records the execution skipped.

JobSummary.base: An object containing the JobId, Status, StartTime, and EndTime of a job.

refs.OutputSource$KMSArn: Customer KMS ARN for encryption at rest. If not provided, system will use an Entity Resolution managed KMS key.

refs.ListMatchingJobsInput$maxResults: The maximum number of objects returned per page.

refs.ListMatchingWorkflowsInput$maxResults: The maximum number of objects returned per page.

refs.ListSchemaMappingsInput$maxResults: The maximum number of objects returned per page.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$workflowArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the MatchingWorkflow.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$workflowArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the MatchingWorkflow.
refs.MatchingWorkflowSummary$workflowArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the MatchingWorkflow.

refs.ListMatchingWorkflowsOutput$workflowSumm: A list of MatchingWorkflowSummary objects, each of which contain the fields WorkflowName, WorkflowArn, CreatedAt, and UpdatedAt.

MatchingWorkflowSummary.base: A list of MatchingWorkflowSummary objects, each of which contain the fields WorkflowName, WorkflowArn, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt.

refs.ListMatchingJobsInput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListSchemaMappings API call.
refs.ListMatchingJobsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListSchemaMappings API call.
refs.ListMatchingWorkflowsInput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListSchemaMappings API call.
refs.ListMatchingWorkflowsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListSchemaMappings API call.
refs.ListSchemaMappingsInput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListSchemaMappings API call.
refs.ListSchemaMappingsOutput$nextToken: The pagination token from the previous ListDomains API call.

OutputAttribute.base: A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. Each of these objects selects a column to be included in the output table, and whether the values of the column should be hashed.

OutputSource.base: A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. Each of these objects selects a column to be included in the output table, and whether the values of the column should be hashed.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$outputSource: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output.
refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$outputSourc: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$outputSourceCo: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$outputSource: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowOutput$outputSourc: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output.

refs.OutputSource$output: A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. Each of these objects selects a column to be included in the output table, and whether the values of the column should be hashed.

refs.GetMatchIdInput$record: The record to fetch the Match ID for.

ResolutionTechniques.base: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$resolutionTe: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties.
refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$resolutionT: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$resolutionTech: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$resolutionTe: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowOutput$resolutionT: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties

refs.ResolutionTechniques$resolutionType: The type of matching. There are two types of matching: RULE_MATCHING and ML_MATCHING.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The resource could not be found. HTTP Status Code: 404

RuleBasedProperties.base: An object which defines the list of matching rules to run and has a field Rules, which is a list of rule objects.

refs.ResolutionTechniques$ruleBasedProperties: An object which defines the list of matching rules to run and has a field Rules, which is a list of rule objects.

refs.RuleBasedProperties$rules: A list of Rule objects, each of which have fields RuleName and MatchingKeys.

refs.Rule$matchingKeys: A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match.

refs.OutputSource$outputS3Path: The S3 path to which Entity Resolution will write the output table.

refs.SchemaInputAttribute$type: The type of the attribute, selected from a list of values.

refs.CreateSchemaMappingInput$mappedInputFiel: A list of MappedInputFields. Each MappedInputField corresponds to a column the source data table, and contains column name plus additional information that Entity Resolution uses for matching.
refs.CreateSchemaMappingOutput$mappedInputFie: A list of MappedInputFields. Each MappedInputField corresponds to a column the source data table, and contains column name plus additional information that Entity Resolution uses for matching.
refs.GetSchemaMappingOutput$mappedInputFields: A list of MappedInputFields. Each MappedInputField corresponds to a column the source data table, and contains column name plus additional information Venice uses for matching.

refs.CreateSchemaMappingOutput$schemaArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the SchemaMapping.
refs.GetSchemaMappingOutput$schemaArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the SchemaMapping.
refs.SchemaMappingSummary$schemaArn: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) that Entity Resolution generated for the SchemaMapping.

refs.ListSchemaMappingsOutput$schemaList: A list of SchemaMappingSummary objects, each of which contain the fields SchemaName, SchemaArn, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.
refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowOutput$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.
refs.ExceedsLimitException$quotaName: The name of the quota that has been breached.
refs.GetMatchIdOutput$matchId: The unique identifiers for this group of match records.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to access resources on your behalf.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowInput$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.
refs.UpdateMatchingWorkflowOutput$roleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.

refs.UntagResourceInput$tagKeys: The list of tag keys to remove from the resource.

refs.CreateMatchingWorkflowInput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
refs.CreateSchemaMappingInput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
refs.GetSchemaMappingOutput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
refs.ListTagsForResourceOutput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
refs.TagResourceInput$tags: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling. HTTP Status Code: 429

refs.GetMatchingJobOutput$endTime: The time at which the job has finished.
refs.GetMatchingJobOutput$startTime: The time at which the job was started.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$createdAt: The timestamp of when the workflow was created.
refs.GetMatchingWorkflowOutput$updatedAt: The timestamp of when the workflow was last updated.
refs.GetSchemaMappingOutput$createdAt: The timestamp of when the SchemaMapping was created.
refs.GetSchemaMappingOutput$updatedAt: The timestamp of when the SchemaMapping was last updated.
refs.JobSummary$endTime: The time at which the job has finished.
refs.JobSummary$startTime: The time at which the job was started.
refs.MatchingWorkflowSummary$createdAt: The timestamp of when the workflow was created.
refs.MatchingWorkflowSummary$updatedAt: The timestamp of when the workflow was last updated.
refs.SchemaMappingSummary$createdAt: The timestamp of when the SchemaMapping was created.
refs.SchemaMappingSummary$updatedAt: The timestamp of when the SchemaMapping was last updated.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by Entity Resolution. HTTP Status Code: 400

refs.ListTagsForResourceInput$resourceArn: The ARN of the resource for which you want to view tags.
refs.TagResourceInput$resourceArn: The ARN of the resource for which you want to view tags.
refs.UntagResourceInput$resourceArn: The ARN of the resource for which you want to untag.
